summary: Season 1
body:
Season 1

Sansa: hey, how ya—

The Hound: GHLARGHH, GHLARRG

Sansa: AAAAAHH ! ! ! GET YOUR FUCKIN DOG BITCH ! ! !

Joffrey: It don’t bite.

Sansa: YES IT DO GET YA…

summary:
Step 1: get her attention
Step 2: eliminate the competition
Step 3: show her that you have interests
Step 4: be supportive of...
body:
The 8 Steps of Seduction by Sandor Clegane

Step 1: get her attention

Step 2: eliminate the competition

Step 3: show her that you have interests

Step 4: be supportive of her hobbies

Step 5: get to know her family

Step 6: be mysterious

Step 7: find ways to casually bump into her

Step 8: when all else fails…eye contact


If steps 1-8 don’t work, fuck her, she’s a cunt that isn’t worth your time.

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary: Game Of Thrones: Season 8
body:
Game Of Thrones: Season 8

Please, please, for the love of the gods, don’t let their be a rivalry or hatred between Sansa/Arya and Daenerys. Sansa and Daenerys have gone through a lot of the same traumatic experiences and both come out on top, while Daenerys and Arya both are females fighting their way through a male-dominated position. These girls would fucking love and respect each other and I will fight anyone who doesn’t agree.

reblog.comment:

blog.name: iheartgot
blog.title: IHEARTGOT
blog.description:
IHEARTGOT is dedicated to the HBO television series Game of Thrones, which is based on the A Song of Ice and Fire novels written by George R. R. Martin, and its cast. We update daily to bring you the latest pictures, edits, gifs and more of the show and the books. 
This is NOT a spoiler-free blog.
We track #iheartgot.

summary: Permit me to share some womanly wisdom with you on this very special day. The more people you love, the weaker you are. You'll...
caption: Permit me to share some womanly wisdom with you on this very special day. The more people you love, the weaker you are. You’ll do things for them that you know you shouldn’t do. You’ll act the fool to make them happy, to keep them safe.

reblog.comment: Permit me to share some womanly wisdom with you on this very special day. The more people you love, the weaker you are. You’ll do things for them that you know you shouldn’t do. You’ll act the fool to make them happy, to keep them safe.

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary:
— Sansa Stark as a Pisces 

             
           Pisces are very emotional people. They're very compassionate and care...
caption:
— Sansa Stark as a Pisces


Pisces are very emotional people. They’re very compassionate and care deeply about people, no matter their differences. It’s easy to prove that Sansa is quite all of this (we can see this side of her in her scenes with the hound, for example).
They easily get caught up in the fantasy of romance, they are delusional about it, which often end up hurting them. They dream about THE true and beautiful love, the one we can find in fairytales. No need of example, Sansa’s whole life is made of this. She first dreamt to marry the king (Joffrey), then a knight (Loras) and ended up disappointed (and even worse) by both. She slowly realized what the reality was made of, and ended up crashing down.
Pisces are also vulnerables. They make easy preys (and here, Baelish took advantage of this). They have no self-confidence and have a tendency to feel underappreciated (in ASOS, Sansa thinks that Margaery will never like her, that she isn’t worth enough to hang up with her).
Last but not least, Pisces are also artists, they’re creative. We can see this side of Sansa when she builds the snow castle or we can also state the fact that she’s really good at sewing.

summary: Y’all I spent some time rewatching some Jon and Sansa scenes and I just want to proudly say that Sansa Stark is the smartest...
body:
It is 100% a Fact That Jon Snow Was Invited to Dragonstone Under False Pretenses!

Y’all I spent some time rewatching some Jon and Sansa scenes and I just want to proudly say that Sansa Stark is the smartest bitch in this game and once again I’m so blown away by her!!!

Now that that’s out of the way let me dive into this meta:

There has been so much debate on weather or not Jon was a prisoner/trapped at Dragonstone and I’m here to tell you that he was. I mean honestly when the debates were going on I was super indifferent about it but I came across dialogue in season 7 that completely went over my head. Before I talk about the scene, one thing I want to make clear is that Tyrion wrote a a letter to Jon Snow under the pretense that they would be ALLIES, NOT TO BEND THE KNEE! Don’t believe me? Here’s what that scroll said:

The Seven Kingdoms bleed as long as Cersei sits on the Iron Throne. Join us! TOGETHER we can end her tyranny!

This letter is completely different from the one Cersei sends in the first episode of season 7. In Cersei’s scroll she clearly says:

BEND THE KNEE or suffer the fate of all traitors!

Her intent is absolutely clear and in Tyrion’s it’s not! The reason why Tyrion wrote the letter under this false pretense is that he knew if he was clear about Dany’s intentions of inviting him to Dragonstone he wouldn’t have come.

Dragon glass or not if Jon knew that Dany would want him to bend the knee he wouldn’t have gone!!!

That might be a bold statement for some but it’s the truth and here’s why:

Jon: It could be, but I DON’T BELIEVE TYRION WOULD DO THAT. You know him he’s a good man!

First and foremost I just want to point out that this is TWO seasons now were Sansa (who is so fucking brilliant) explicitly warns Jon about the political games at play and BOTH TIMES she has been prove right!! So to that I say:

You best believe that in season 8 we are never going to get this moment again:

And Jon’s ass is definitely going to be like “yes dear” and “I’m listening to my sister/cousin/wife!” Because Jon has learned the hard way TWICE!!

Now Back to The Meta.

Jon naively went to Dragonstone solely on the belief that Tyrion is a good man and that he was someone Jon could trust! He truly believed that he could convince them of threat of the white walkers and gain an alliance WITHOUT giving up his kingdom! The dialogue makes the plot clear as day and most people (including me) entirely missed this plot when season 7 aired!

What Tyrion did was fucked up to say the least and I think the show was trying to subtly warn us about how we should be viewing the events in Jon and Dany’s first meeting. First we have the scenes were they strip Jon and his men of their weapons but then they give us this scene:

Jon: She’s starting to let on!

Y’all:

If this wasn’t the biggest Wink Wink pay attention to what happens next to the audience, I don’t know what is! In the next scene Sansa’s warnings come to past and we clearly have an irritated and frustrated Jon Snow who is not only blindsided but clearly pissed off at Tyrion who deceived his ass!! Don’t believe me? Go rewatch that scene!

That’s why Daenerys and Jon’s meeting was filled with so much friction! That was the true plot that we missed in that scene and that’s why we see Jon react like this in his next interaction with Tyrion:

Right off the bat, Jon gets straight to the point and tell us how he really feels about the situation he finds himself in at Dragonstone. To summarize he says “I’m a prisoner on this island” “you took my ship” and “I’m a northern fool” for coming in the first place. Tyrion never really cops to what he did but essentially he tells Jon that she should try harder and get to know Daenerys more. Then he throws Jon a “Dragon-glass” bone to try and make up for what he did. Lol!

I say all of this to say that this was the major plot that I believe went over everyone’s head in season 7! Yes, Jon willingly went to Dragonstone to seek an alliance but he did so because he didn’t think his kingdom would ever be at stake because of his trust in Tyrion. Jon was never at Dragonstone under friendly terms or circumstances and he never had an equal status as King! That’s why in episode 5 Jon hauled ass so fast off of that island like his life depended on it.

The circumstances of this situation to me requires political Jon and makes political Jon fair game! I absolutely believe Jon went to Dragonstone with good intentions but quickly realized that Tyrion and Dany’s intentions weren’t as true as his own. Hence him being metaphorically and physically trapped at Dragonstone!

Jon naively went to Dragonstone solely on the belief that Tyrion is a good man and that he was someone Jon could trust! He truly believed that he could convince them of threat of the white walkers and gain an alliance WITHOUT giving up his kingdom! The dialogue makes the plot clear as day and most people (including me) entirely missed this plot when season 7 aired!

What Tyrion did was fucked up to say the least and I think the show was trying to subtly warn us about how we should be viewing the events in Jon and Dany’s first meeting. First we have the scenes were they strip Jon and his men of their weapons but then they give us this scene:

Jon: She’s starting to let on!

Y’all:

If this wasn’t the biggest Wink Wink pay attention to what happens next to the audience, I don’t know what is! In the next scene Sansa’s warnings come to past and we clearly have an irritated and frustrated Jon Snow who is not only blindsided but clearly pissed off at Tyrion who deceived his ass!! Don’t believe me? Go rewatch that scene!

That’s why Daenerys and Jon’s meeting was filled with so much friction! That was the true plot that we missed in that scene and that’s why we see Jon react like this in his next interaction with Tyrion:

Right off the bat, Jon gets straight to the point and tell us how he really feels about the situation he finds himself in at Dragonstone. To summarize he says “I’m a prisoner on this island” “you took my ship” and “I’m a northern fool” for coming in the first place. Tyrion never really cops to what he did but essentially he tells Jon that she should try harder and get to know Daenerys more. Then he throws Jon a “Dragon-glass” bone to try and make up for what he did. Lol!

I say all of this to say that this was the major plot that I believe went over everyone’s head in season 7! Yes, Jon willingly went to Dragonstone to seek an alliance but he did so because he didn’t think his kingdom would ever be at stake because of his trust in Tyrion. Jon was never at Dragonstone under friendly terms or circumstances and he never had an equal status as King! That’s why in episode 5 Jon hauled ass so fast off of that island like his life depended on it.

The circumstances of this situation to me requires political Jon and makes political Jon fair game! I absolutely believe Jon went to Dragonstone with good intentions but quickly realized that Tyrion and Dany’s intentions weren’t as true as his own. Hence him being metaphorically and physically trapped at Dragonstone!

tags: Will there be a love scene?
Will there be a sex scene?
I hope for a really nice kiss though
summary: I just think that in order for Sansa arc to come full circle we as an audience need to see her reclaim all aspects of her life...
question: I just think that in order for Sansa arc to come full circle we as an audience need to see her reclaim all aspects of her life that Rasmay tried to steal from her. There are many sex scenes that showrunners claim are important for the characters development as guise to just justify having more boobs on screen. Well I think after the whole Ramsay diabolical, Sansa's future sex scene would actually be for the purpose of character development. At this point I don't mind if she chooses someone other
answer:
(2) than jon, I just want to see her overcome what Ramsay did to her and find happiness. And if GOT ends without Sansa getting an orgasam after all the sexual harasment and objectification she went through, right from the begining when Robert eyed her up and down, I’ll be seriously PISSED. 

Dear nonny,
if you look closely many of the sex scenes on the show were very problematic. I would say that only Robb /Talisa and Missandei /Greyworm was what we would call consensual, unproblematic sex. Jaime/ Cersei has its own problems and Jon /Ygritte does have some consent issues. So, imho a sex scene per se wouldn’t necessarily be positive.
I can understand that you think that Sansa needs nice sex, and that the audience should be somehow be aware of it. But I don’t think that for that it would be actually necessary to show a sex scene. What I really want for Sansa is a nice and tender LOVE scene. That can be a sex scene but imho does not have to be one.
If for example they carry the Ned/ Cat parallels to their logical conclusion, we could see a passionate kiss and later some nice und cuddly snuggling in bed, just like Ned and Cat and a very satisfied, loving and tender smile on Sansa’s face and love struck Jon at her side. It would make a nice contrast as well to all the gratuitous sex scenes we had. And it would be enough for me.
I wonder about the contrasts tbh. For example, we never saw Cersei naked until her walk of shame and thus it had a profound impact and showed us how she was deprived of her dignity and it might be that they want to show love rather than passion with Jon and Sansa and I would be o.k. with that as long as it is clear that she has found her home and her happiness.
If however they fail the convey that, I’ll be as pissed as you!
Thanks for the ask!
